common

Interface Metadata<D extends Directory<?>>

  • Type Parameters:
    D - the specific type of Directory handled by this metadata container, such as DirectoryIFD or PngDirectory
    All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<D>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    PngMetadataProvider, TifMetadataProvider
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    PngMetadata, TifMetadata

    public interface Metadata<D extends Directory<?>>
extends java.lang.Iterable<D>
    A unified container for image metadata, organised into one or more Directory objects. This interface provides a standard way to manage, query, and traverse metadata extracted from various image formats, i.e. TIFF, PNG, JPEG, etc.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addDirectory(D directory)
      Adds a metadata directory to the collection.
      default java.util.Date extractDate()
      Performs a best-effort extraction of the image's creation or capture date.
      java.nio.ByteOrder getByteOrder()
      Returns the global byte order used by the image format.
      default boolean hasExifData()
      Indicates whether the container holds EXIF metadata.
      default boolean hasMetadata()
      Checks if the metadata collection contains any metadata entries.
      default boolean hasXmpData()
      Indicates whether the container holds XMP (Adobe Extensible Metadata Platform) metadata.
      boolean isEmpty()
      Checks if the metadata collection is empty.
      boolean removeDirectory(D directory)
      Removes a metadata directory from the collection.

      • Methods inherited from interface java.lang.Iterable

        forEach, iterator, spliterator

    • Method Detail

      • addDirectory

        void addDirectory(D directory)
        Adds a metadata directory to the collection.
        Parameters:
        directory - the directory to add

      • removeDirectory

        boolean removeDirectory(D directory)
        Removes a metadata directory from the collection.
        Parameters:
        directory - the directory to remove
        Returns:
        true if the directory was found and removed, otherwise false

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty()
        Checks if the metadata collection is empty.
        Returns:
        true if the collection contains no directories, otherwise false

      • getByteOrder

        java.nio.ByteOrder getByteOrder()
        Returns the global byte order used by the image format. Note: specific metadata segments (like EXIF) may define their own internal endian-ness.
        Returns:
        either ByteOrder.BIG_ENDIAN or ByteOrder.LITTLE_ENDIAN

      • hasMetadata

        default boolean hasMetadata()
        Checks if the metadata collection contains any metadata entries.
        Returns:
        true if at least one directory is present, otherwise false

      • hasExifData

        default boolean hasExifData()
        Indicates whether the container holds EXIF metadata.
        Returns:
        true if EXIF metadata is present, otherwise false

      • hasXmpData

        default boolean hasXmpData()
        Indicates whether the container holds XMP (Adobe Extensible Metadata Platform) metadata.
        Returns:
        true if XMP metadata is present, otherwise false

      • extractDate

        default java.util.Date extractDate()
        Performs a best-effort extraction of the image's creation or capture date.

        Implementations should prioritise high-fidelity sources, i.e. EXIF DateTimeOriginal before falling back to less reliable sources, i.e. file modification time.

        Returns:
        the prioritised Date instance, or null if no temporal metadata is found
